etymology.description: Ideogrammic: a 〇 marking the top edge of a 鼎 (ding), indicating “round.”
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicted a circle marking the rim of a ritual ding to convey the idea “round,” a value that survives in 圓/圆. It was later borrowed for the meaning “member; personnel,” so the modern usage reflects the borrowed sense rather than the original picture.
etymology.simplification: Simplified from 員 by replacing 貝 with 贝 and streamlining the structure (員 → 员).

examples.chinese: 他是博物馆的会员(他是博物館的會員)。
examples.english: He is a member of the museum.

examples.chinese: 公司需要新员工(公司需要新員工)。
活动现场的工作人员很热情(活動現場的工作人員很熱情)。
examples.pinyin: Huódòng xiànchǎng de gōngzuò rényuán hěn rèqíng.
examples.english: The on-site staff are very friendly.
